notes: Employee = social insurance + health; employer = social insurance + health
Total contributions ~22% (split employee/employer as shown). Some guides present breakdowns by scheme.
Funded pension contributions are largely employee-paid; employers do not pay a separate social security percentage (state co-finances some schemes). See local rules for thresholds and caps.
Rates shown are the common combined rates; specific components (pension/health/unemployment/accident) make up the totals and some items have contribution ceilings.
Standard rates for most employees; some industry-specific rules (e.g., oil & gas) and small additional rates (medical, unemployment) may apply.
Applies to Bahraini (national) employees; expatriate employees have different (usually lower) contribution rules. Employer rate increased in recent years (phased up to 20% by 2028 in some schedules).
No single mandatory national social-security percentage applied to all employees (provident funds/gratuity arrangements are typical); practices vary and many sources treat PF as contractual/sectoral.

Typical breakdown: employee pays small pension/social percentage (~1%); employers pay the large bulk (~28% pension + ~6% social + minor accident insurance). Check local official table for exact class-based accident-insurance rates.
